meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! Here's my review of Wizardry: Proving Grounds of the Mad Overlord. But before I dive in, let me just say that I'm not a hardcore gamer like some of those other critics out there. Heck, I still have trouble navigating the menu screens in Final Fantasy VII without getting lost in the world of Spira!

Now, onto Wizardry! This remake takes you back to the days of yore when RPGs were all about crawling through dungeons, slaying monsters, and... well, dying a lot. The game stays true to its 1981 roots, but with some modern tweaks to make it more accessible (ish).

I've gotta give credit where credit is due – Digital Eclipse did an amazing job of bringing this classic back to life without sacrificing the original's charm. If you're a fan of old-school RPGs like me (ahem, not as hardcore as those other critics), you'll appreciate the nostalgic value and punishing gameplay.

That being said, it's not all sunshine and rainbows. The game could benefit from some more modern touches – think character customization on steroids! And don't even get me started on the difficulty level... let's just say I died. A lot. Like, a LOT.

So, is Wizardry Proving Grounds of the Mad Overlord for you? Well, if you're up for a challenge and want to relive some good ol' RPG nostalgia, then yes! Just be prepared to die. A lot. Again, like, a LOT.

Oh, and one more thing – what's with all these critics giving it high scores? I mean, sure it's a solid remake, but is it really worth 70-80 points? Maybe I'm just being too harsh (or not harsh enough), but I think you get my point!

That's it for now! Let me know if you have any questions or want to chat about Wizardry. And remember – Hippo Penny is always ready with some good ol' fashioned humor and gaming goodness!
